basics.name: Ian Melvin
basics.label: Game Programmer | Software Engineer
basics.summary: I am currently working on a 3D Combat Arcade Racing Game called Dead Pedal @ Faycrest Studios and developing games for research purposes with the University of Vermont.

work.summary: Developing an arcade combat racing game called Dead Pedal and developing games under contract for other companies
highlights: Integrate Vehicle AI and driving systems while expanding the features of both
Collaborate with artists to develop systems supporting their assets (UI and Power Ups)
Working in a code base developed by multiple other programmers prior to me joining

work.summary: Develop WebGL games in Unity for studying how people respond to situations, like flooding, with the data used for research papers
highlights: Working in Unity and Blender, using C#
Construct custom systems for things incompatible with Unity’s WebGL builds (like Gifs & Fluid Simulation)
Collaborate in meetings with fellow programmers and researchers to ensure the game gathers needed data
Tested published games such as: Pupperazi, Skater Gator, and Dot’s Home
Provided reports of any bugs and how to trigger them, as well as difficulty to complete tasks and other quality related questions

volunteer.summary: As a member of the Card Committee, I develop new game content and ensure it is compatible with the games structure
highlights: Join together with peers to craft new cards and iterate on existing content
Plan out fun ways to introduce cards to the player base
